DataElement.preferredName: Smoking Adult Cigarette Quitting Method Questionnaire Assessment Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The act of puffing and/or inhaling smoke from a lit cigarette, cigar, or pipe._An age group comprised of humans who have reached reproductive age._Finely cut tobacco encased in a wrapper of thin paper and rolled for smoking._Put an end to a state or an activity._A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal._A predetermined set of questions._a free text field to specify information on the evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease

ReferenceDocuments.name: These self-administered quest
ReferenceDocuments.description: These self-administered questions ask current smokers about their attempts to stop smoking cigarettes within the past 3 months and what method or methods they used to quit.
